1. Nonaspirin analgesic drugs: These are chemicals used to relieve pain and reduce inflammation. Examples include acetaminophen (Tylenol) and ibuprofen (Advil).
2. NSAIDs: Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs are a type of chemical compound that reduce pain and inflammation. Examples include aspirin, naproxen (Aleve), and celecoxib (Celebrex).

Therefore, the "chemical" entities in the paragraph are nonaspirin analgesic drugs and NSAIDs.
